files.eol.description: The default end of line character.

files.exclude.markdownDescription: Configure [glob patterns](https://aka.ms/vscode-glob-patterns) for excluding files and folders. For example, the File Explorer decides which files and folders to show or hide based on this setting. Refer to the `#search.exclude#` setting to define search-specific excludes. Refer to the `#explorer.excludeGitIgnore#` setting for ignoring files based on your `.gitignore`.

enumDescriptions: Enable the pattern.
Disable the pattern.
anyOf.description: The glob pattern to match file paths against. Set to true or false to enable or disable the pattern.

when.markdownDescription: Additional check on the siblings of a matching file. Use \$(basename) as variable for the matching file name.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Disable hot exit. A prompt will show when attempting to close a window with editors that have unsaved changes.

Hot exit will be triggered when the last window is closed on Windows/Linux or when the `workbench.action.quit` command is triggered (command palette, keybinding, menu). All windows without folders opened will be restored upon next launch. A list of previously opened windows with unsaved files can be accessed via `File > Open Recent > More...`

Hot exit will be triggered when the last window is closed on Windows/Linux or when the `workbench.action.quit` command is triggered (command palette, keybinding, menu), and also for any window with a folder opened regardless of whether it's the last window. All windows without folders opened will be restored upon next launch. A list of previously opened windows with unsaved files can be accessed via `File > Open Recent > More...`
files.hotExit.description: Controls whether unsaved files are remembered between sessions, allowing the save prompt when exiting the editor to be skipped.

files.insertFinalNewline.description: When enabled, insert a final new line at the end of the file when saving it.

files.participants.timeout.markdownDescription: Timeout in milliseconds after which file participants for create, rename, and delete are cancelled. Use `0` to disable participants.

files.readonlyExclude.markdownDescription: Configure paths or [glob patterns](https://aka.ms/vscode-glob-patterns) to exclude from being marked as read-only if they match as a result of the `#files.readonlyInclude#` setting. Glob patterns are always evaluated relative to the path of the workspace folder unless they are absolute paths. Files from readonly file system providers will always be read-only independent of this setting.

files.readonlyFromPermissions.markdownDescription: Marks files as read-only when their file permissions indicate as such. This can be overridden via `#files.readonlyInclude#` and `#files.readonlyExclude#` settings.

files.readonlyInclude.markdownDescription: Configure paths or [glob patterns](https://aka.ms/vscode-glob-patterns) to mark as read-only. Glob patterns are always evaluated relative to the path of the workspace folder unless they are absolute paths. You can exclude matching paths via the `#files.readonlyExclude#` setting. Files from readonly file system providers will always be read-only independent of this setting.

files.refactoring.autoSave.description: Controls if files that were part of a refactoring are saved automatically

files.restoreUndoStack.description: Restore the undo stack when a file is reopened.

enumDescriptions: Will refuse to save and ask for resolving the save conflict manually.
Will resolve the save conflict by overwriting the file on disk with the changes in the editor.
files.saveConflictResolution.description: A save conflict can occur when a file is saved to disk that was changed by another program in the meantime. To prevent data loss, the user is asked to compare the changes in the editor with the version on disk. This setting should only be changed if you frequently encounter save conflict errors and may result in data loss if used without caution.

files.simpleDialog.enable.description: Enables the simple file dialog for opening and saving files and folders. The simple file dialog replaces the system file dialog when enabled.

files.trimFinalNewlines.description: When enabled, will trim all new lines after the final new line at the end of the file when saving it.

files.trimTrailingWhitespace.description: When enabled, will trim trailing whitespace when saving a file.

files.watcherExclude.markdownDescription: Configure paths or [glob patterns](https://aka.ms/vscode-glob-patterns) to exclude from file watching. Paths can either be relative to the watched folder or absolute. Glob patterns are matched relative from the watched folder. When you experience the file watcher process consuming a lot of CPU, make sure to exclude large folders that are of less interest (such as build output folders).

files.watcherInclude.description: Configure extra paths to watch for changes inside the workspace. By default, all workspace folders will be watched recursively, except for folders that are symbolic links. You can explicitly add absolute or relative paths to support watching folders that are symbolic links. Relative paths will be resolved to an absolute path using the currently opened workspace.

git.allowForcePush.description: Controls whether force push (with or without lease) is enabled.

git.allowNoVerifyCommit.description: Controls whether commits without running pre-commit and commit-msg hooks are allowed.

git.alwaysShowStagedChangesResourceGroup.description: Always show the Staged Changes resource group.

git.alwaysSignOff.description: Controls the signoff flag for all commits.

git.autofetch.markdownDescription: When set to true, commits will automatically be fetched from the default remote of the current Git repository. Setting to `all` will fetch from all remotes.

git.autofetchPeriod.markdownDescription: Duration in seconds between each automatic git fetch, when `#git.autofetch#` is enabled.

enumDescriptions: Disable automatic repository scanning.
Scan for parent folders of open files.
Scan for subfolders of the currently opened folder.
Scan for both subfolders of the current opened folder and parent folders of open files.
git.autoRepositoryDetection.description: Configures when repositories should be automatically detected.

git.autoStash.description: Stash any changes before pulling and restore them after successful pull.

git.branchPrefix.description: Prefix used when creating a new branch.

git.branchProtection.markdownDescription: List of protected branches. By default, a prompt is shown before changes are committed to a protected branch. The prompt can be controlled using the `#git.branchProtectionPrompt#`  setting.

git.branchProtectionPrompt.description: Controls whether a prompt is being shown before changes are committed to a protected branch.
enumDescriptions: Always commit changes to the protected branch.
Always commit changes to a new branch.
Always prompt before changes are committed to a protected branch.

git.branchRandomName.dictionary.markdownDescription: List of dictionaries used for the randomly generated branch name. Each value represents the dictionary used to generate the segment of the branch name. Supported dictionaries: `adjectives`, `animals`, `colors` and `numbers`.

enumDescriptions: A random adjective
A random animal name
A random color name
A random number between 100 and 999

git.branchRandomName.enable.description: Controls whether a random name is generated when creating a new branch.

git.branchSortOrder.description: Controls the sort order for branches.

git.branchValidationRegex.description: A regular expression to validate new branch names.

git.branchWhitespaceChar.description: The character to replace whitespace in new branch names, and to separate segments of a randomly generated branch name.

enumDescriptions: Local branches
Remote branches
Tags

git.checkoutType.markdownDescription: Controls what type of git refs are listed when running `Checkout to...`.

git.closeDiffOnOperation.description: Controls whether the diff editor should be automatically closed when changes are stashed, committed, discarded, staged, or unstaged.

git.commandsToLog.markdownDescription: List of git commands (ex: commit, push) that would have their `stdout` logged to the [git output](command:git.showOutput). If the git command has a client-side hook configured, the client-side hook's `stdout` will also be logged to the [git output](command:git.showOutput).

git.confirmEmptyCommits.description: Always confirm the creation of empty commits for the 'Git: Commit Empty' command.

git.confirmForcePush.description: Controls whether to ask for confirmation before force-pushing.

git.confirmNoVerifyCommit.description: Controls whether to ask for confirmation before committing without verification.

enumDescriptions: Count all changes.
Turn off counter.
Count only tracked changes.

git.decorations.enabled.description: Controls whether Git contributes colors and badges to the Explorer and the Open Editors view.

git.defaultBranchName.markdownDescription: The name of the default branch (ex: main, trunk, development) when initializing a new git repository. When set to empty, the default branch name configured in git will be used. **Note:** Requires git version `2.28.0` or later.

git.defaultCloneDirectory.description: The default location to clone a git repository.

git.detectSubmodules.description: Controls whether to automatically detect git submodules.

git.detectSubmodulesLimit.description: Controls the limit of git submodules detected.

git.enableCommitSigning.description: Enables commit signing with GPG or X.509.

git.enableSmartCommit.description: Commit all changes when there are no staged changes.

git.enableStatusBarSync.description: Controls whether the Git Sync command appears in the status bar.

git.fetchOnPull.description: When enabled, fetch all branches when pulling. Otherwise, fetch just the current one.

git.followTagsWhenSync.description: Push all annotated tags when running the sync command.

git.githubAuthentication.deprecationMessage: This setting is now deprecated, please use `github.gitAuthentication` instead.

git.ignoredRepositories.description: List of git repositories to ignore.

git.ignoreLimitWarning.description: Ignores the warning when there are too many changes in a repository.

git.ignoreMissingGitWarning.description: Ignores the warning when Git is missing.

git.ignoreRebaseWarning.description: Ignores the warning when it looks like the branch might have been rebased when pulling.

git.ignoreSubmodules.description: Ignore modifications to submodules in the file tree.

git.ignoreWindowsGit27Warning.description: Ignores the warning when Git 2.25 - 2.26 is installed on Windows.

git.inputValidation.description: Controls when to show commit message input validation.

git.inputValidationLength.description: Controls the commit message length threshold for showing a warning.

git.inputValidationSubjectLength.description: Controls the commit message subject length threshold for showing a warning. Unset it to inherit the value of `config.inputValidationLength`.

git.mergeEditor.markdownDescription: Open the merge editor for files that are currently under conflict.

enumDescriptions: Always open in current window.
Always open in a new window.
Always prompt for action.
Only open in current window when no folder is opened.
git.openAfterClone.description: Controls whether to open a repository automatically after cloning.

git.openDiffOnClick.description: Controls whether the diff editor should be opened when clicking a change. Otherwise the regular editor will be opened.

enumDescriptions: Always open a repository in parent folders of workspaces or open files.
Never open a repository in parent folders of workspaces or open files.
Prompt before opening a repository the parent folders of workspaces or open files.
git.openRepositoryInParentFolders.markdownDescription: Control whether a repository in parent folders of workspaces or open files should be opened.

git.optimisticUpdate.markdownDescription: Controls whether to optimistically update the state of the Source Control view after running git commands.

git.path.markdownDescription: Path and filename of the git executable, e.g. `C:\Program Files\Git\bin\git.exe` (Windows). This can also be an array of string values containing multiple paths to look up.

enumDescriptions: Don't run any command after a commit.
Run 'git push' after a successful commit.
Run 'git pull' and 'git push' after a successful commit.
git.postCommitCommand.markdownDescription: Run a git command after a successful commit.

enumDescriptions: Check for any unsaved files.
Disable this check.
Check only for unsaved staged files.
git.promptToSaveFilesBeforeCommit.description: Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before committing.

enumDescriptions: Check for any unsaved files.
Disable this check.
Check only for unsaved staged files.
git.promptToSaveFilesBeforeStash.description: Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before stashing changes.

git.pullBeforeCheckout.description: Controls whether a branch that does not have outgoing commits is fast-forwarded before it is checked out.

git.rebaseWhenSync.description: Force git to use rebase when running the sync command.

git.rememberPostCommitCommand.description: Remember the last git command that ran after a commit.

git.repositoryScanIgnoredFolders.markdownDescription: List of folders that are ignored while scanning for Git repositories when `#git.autoRepositoryDetection#` is set to `true` or `subFolders`.

git.repositoryScanMaxDepth.markdownDescription: Controls the depth used when scanning workspace folders for Git repositories when `#git.autoRepositoryDetection#` is set to `true` or `subFolders`. Can be set to `-1` for no limit.

git.requireGitUserConfig.description: Controls whether to require explicit Git user configuration or allow Git to guess if missing.

git.scanRepositories.description: List of paths to search for git repositories in.

git.showActionButton.description: Controls whether an action button is shown in the Source Control view.

commit.description: Show an action button to commit changes when the local branch has modified files ready to be committed.

publish.description: Show an action button to publish the local branch when it does not have a tracking remote branch.

sync.description: Show an action button to synchronize changes when the local branch is either ahead or behind the remote branch.

git.showCommitInput.description: Controls whether to show the commit input in the Git source control panel.

git.showInlineOpenFileAction.description: Controls whether to show an inline Open File action in the Git changes view.

git.showProgress.description: Controls whether git actions should show progress.

git.showPushSuccessNotification.description: Controls whether to show a notification when a push is successful.

git.similarityThreshold.markdownDescription: Controls the threshold of the similarity index (i.e. amount of additions/deletions compared to the file's size) for changes in a pair of added/deleted files to be considered a rename. **Note:** Requires git version `2.18.0` or later.

enumDescriptions: Automatically stage all changes.
Automatically stage tracked changes only.
git.smartCommitChanges.description: Control which changes are automatically staged by Smart Commit.

git.statusLimit.description: Controls how to limit the number of changes that can be parsed from Git status command. Can be set to 0 for no limit.

git.suggestSmartCommit.description: Suggests to enable smart commit (commit all changes when there are no staged changes).

git.supportCancellation.description: Controls whether a notification comes up when running the Sync action, which allows the user to cancel the operation.

git.terminalAuthentication.description: Controls whether to enable VS Code to be the authentication handler for Git processes spawned in the Integrated Terminal. Note: Terminals need to be restarted to pick up a change in this setting.

git.terminalGitEditor.description: Controls whether to enable VS Code to be the Git editor for Git processes spawned in the integrated terminal. Note: Terminals need to be restarted to pick up a change in this setting.

enumDescriptions: Use the authored date
Use the committed date
git.timeline.date.description: Controls which date to use for items in the Timeline view.

git.timeline.showAuthor.description: Controls whether to show the commit author in the Timeline view.

git.timeline.showUncommitted.description: Controls whether to show uncommitted changes in the Timeline view.

enumDescriptions: Untracked changes are hidden and excluded from several actions.
All changes, tracked and untracked, appear together and behave equally.
Untracked changes appear separately in the Source Control view. They are also excluded from several actions.

git.useCommitInputAsStashMessage.description: Controls whether to use the message from the commit input box as the default stash message.

git.useEditorAsCommitInput.description: Controls whether a full text editor will be used to author commit messages, whenever no message is provided in the commit input box.

git.useForcePushWithLease.description: Controls whether force pushing uses the safer force-with-lease variant.

git.useIntegratedAskPass.description: Controls whether GIT_ASKPASS should be overwritten to use the integrated version.

git.verboseCommit.markdownDescription: Enable verbose output when `#git.useEditorAsCommitInput#` is enabled.

github.branchProtection.description: Controls whether to query repository rules for GitHub repositories

github.gitAuthentication.description: Controls whether to enable automatic GitHub authentication for git commands within VS Code.

github.gitProtocol.description: Controls which protocol is used to clone a GitHub repository

grunt.autoDetect.description: Controls enablement of Grunt task detection. Grunt task detection can cause files in any open workspace to be executed.

gulp.autoDetect.description: Controls enablement of Gulp task detection. Gulp task detection can cause files in any open workspace to be executed.

html.autoCreateQuotes.description: Enable/disable auto creation of quotes for HTML attribute assignment. The type of quotes can be configured by `#html.completion.attributeDefaultValue#`.

enumDescriptions: Attribute value is set to "".
Attribute value is not set.
Attribute value is set to ''.
html.completion.attributeDefaultValue.description: Controls the default value for attributes when completion is accepted.

html.customData.markdownDescription:
A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-html-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

VS Code loads custom data on startup to enhance its HTML support for the custom HTML tags, attributes and attribute values you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.

html.format.contentUnformatted.markdownDescription: List of tags, comma separated, where the content shouldn't be reformatted. `null` defaults to the `pre` tag.

html.format.extraLiners.markdownDescription: List of tags, comma separated, that should have an extra newline before them. `null` defaults to `"head, body, /html"`.

html.format.maxPreserveNewLines.markdownDescription: Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk. Use `null` for unlimited.

html.format.preserveNewLines.description: Controls whether existing line breaks before elements should be preserved. Only works before elements, not inside tags or for text.

html.format.templating.description: Honor django, erb, handlebars and php templating language tags.

html.format.unformatted.markdownDescription: List of tags, comma separated, that shouldn't be reformatted. `null` defaults to all tags listed at https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#phrasing-content.

html.format.unformattedContentDelimiter.markdownDescription: Keep text content together between this string.

enumDescriptions: Wrap when line length is exceeded, align attributes vertically.
Wrap attributes only when line length is exceeded.
Wrap each attribute except first.
Wrap each attribute except first and keep aligned.
Wrap each attribute.
Preserve wrapping of attributes.
Preserve wrapping of attributes but align.

html.format.wrapAttributesIndentSize.markdownDescription: Indent wrapped attributes to after N characters. Use `null` to use the default indent size. Ignored if `#html.format.wrapAttributes#` is set to 'aligned'.

html.format.wrapLineLength.description: Maximum amount of characters per line (0 = disable).

html.hover.documentation.description: Show tag and attribute documentation in hover.

html.hover.references.description: Show references to MDN in hover.

html.mirrorCursorOnMatchingTag.description: Enable/disable mirroring cursor on matching HTML tag.

html.suggest.html5.description: Controls whether the built-in HTML language support suggests HTML5 tags, properties and values.

html.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the HTML language server.

html.validate.scripts.description: Controls whether the built-in HTML language support validates embedded scripts.

html.validate.styles.description: Controls whether the built-in HTML language support validates embedded styles.

http.proxy.markdownDescription: The proxy setting to use. If not set, will be inherited from the `http_proxy` and `https_proxy` environment variables.

http.proxyAuthorization.markdownDescription: The value to send as the `Proxy-Authorization` header for every network request.

http.proxyStrictSSL.description: Controls whether the proxy server certificate should be verified against the list of supplied CAs.

enumDescriptions: Enable proxy support for extensions, fall back to request options, when no proxy found.
Disable proxy support for extensions.
Enable proxy support for extensions.
Enable proxy support for extensions, override request options.
http.proxySupport.description: Use the proxy support for extensions.

http.systemCertificates.description: Controls whether CA certificates should be loaded from the OS. (On Windows and macOS, a reload of the window is required after turning this off.)

inlineChat.mode.description: Configure if changes crafted in the interactive editor are applied directly to the document or are previewed first.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Changes are applied directly to the document but can be highlighted via inline diffs. Ending a session will keep the changes.
Changes are applied directly to the document and are highlighted visually via inline or side-by-side diffs. Ending a session will keep the changes.
Changes are previewed only and need to be accepted via the apply button. Ending a session will discard the changes.

interactiveWindow.alwaysScrollOnNewCell.markdownDescription: Automatically scroll the interactive window to show the output of the last statement executed. If this value is false, the window will only scroll if the last cell was already the one scrolled to.

interactiveWindow.collapseCellInputCode.markdownDescription: Controls whether code cells in the interactive window are collapsed by default.

ipynb.pasteImagesAsAttachments.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable/disable pasting of images into Markdown cells in ipynb notebook files. Pasted images are inserted as attachments to the cell.

jake.autoDetect.description: Controls enablement of Jake task detection. Jake task detection can cause files in any open workspace to be executed.

javascript.autoClosingTags.description: Enable/disable automatic closing of JSX tags.

javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterCommaD.description: Defines space handling after a comma delimiter.

javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterConstr.description: Defines space handling after the constructor keyword.

javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterFuncti.description: Defines space handling after function keyword for anonymous functions.

javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterKeywor.description: Defines space handling after keywords in a control flow statement.

javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpenin.description: Defines space handling after opening and before closing empty braces.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing JSX expression braces.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty braces.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty brackets.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing non-empty parenthesis.
Defines space handling after opening and before closing template string braces.

javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterSemico.description: Defines space handling after a semicolon in a for statement.

javascript.format.insertSpaceBeforeAndAf.description: Defines space handling after a binary operator.

javascript.format.insertSpaceBeforeFunct.description: Defines space handling before function argument parentheses.

javascript.format.placeOpenBraceOnNewLin.description: Defines whether an open brace is put onto a new line for control blocks or not.
Defines whether an open brace is put onto a new line for functions or not.

enumDescriptions: Don't insert or remove any semicolons.
Insert semicolons at statement ends.
Remove unnecessary semicolons.

javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs.markdownDescription: Enable/disable semantic checking of JavaScript files. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been deprecated in favor of `js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs`.
javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs.deprecationMessage: This setting has been deprecated in favor of `js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs`.

javascript.implicitProjectConfig.experim.markdownDescription: Enable/disable `experimentalDecorators` in JavaScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.
javascript.implicitProjectConfig.experim.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been deprecated in favor of `js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.experimentalDecorators`.
javascript.implicitProjectConfig.experim.deprecationMessage: This setting has been deprecated in favor of `js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.experimentalDecorators`.

enumDescriptions: Enable parameter name hints for literal and non-literal arguments.
Enable parameter name hints only for literal arguments.
Disable parameter name hints.
javascript.inlayHints.parameterNames.ena.markdownDescription:
Enable/disable inlay hints for parameter names:
```typescript

parseInt(/* str: */ '123', /* radix: */ 8)
 
```

javascript.inlayHints.parameterNames.sup.markdownDescription: Suppress parameter name hints on arguments whose text is identical to the parameter name.

javascript.inlayHints.parameterTypes.ena.markdownDescription:
Enable/disable inlay hints for implicit parameter types:
```typescript

el.addEventListener('click', e /* :MouseEvent */ => ...)
 
```

javascript.inlayHints.variableTypes.enab.markdownDescription:
Enable/disable inlay hints for implicit variable types:
```typescript

const foo /* :number */ = Date.now();
 
```

javascript.inlayHints.variableTypes.supp.markdownDescription: Suppress type hints on variables whose name is identical to the type name. Requires using TypeScript 4.8+ in the workspace.

javascript.preferences.autoImportFileExc.markdownDescription: Specify glob patterns of files to exclude from auto imports. Requires using TypeScript 4.8 or newer in the workspace.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Prefers a non-relative import based on the `baseUrl` or `paths` configured in your `jsconfig.json` / `tsconfig.json`.
Prefers a non-relative import only if the relative import path would leave the package or project directory.
Prefers a relative path to the imported file location.
Prefers a non-relative import only if one is available that has fewer path segments than a relative import.
javascript.preferences.importModuleSpeci.description: Preferred path style for auto imports.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Use project settings to select a default.
Do not shorten path endings; include the `.js` or `.ts` extension.
javascript.preferences.importModuleSpeci.description: Preferred path ending for auto imports.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Insert `={}` or `=""` after attribute names based on the prop type. See `javascript.preferences.quoteStyle` to control the type of quotes used for string attributes.
javascript.preferences.jsxAttributeCompl.description: Preferred style for JSX attribute completions.

javascript.preferences.quoteStyle.markdownDescription: Preferred quote style to use for Quick Fixes.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Infer quote type from existing code

javascript.preferences.renameMatchingJsx.description: When on a JSX tag, try to rename the matching tag instead of renaming the symbol. Requires using TypeScript 5.1+ in the workspace.

javascript.preferences.renameShorthandPr.description: Enable/disable introducing aliases for object shorthand properties during renames.
javascript.preferences.renameShorthandPr.deprecationMessage: The setting 'typescript.preferences.renameShorthandProperties' has been deprecated in favor of 'typescript.preferences.useAliasesForRenames'

javascript.preferences.useAliasesForRena.description: Enable/disable introducing aliases for object shorthand properties during renames.

javascript.preferGoToSourceDefinition.description: Makes Go to Definition avoid type declaration files when possible by triggering Go to Source Definition instead. This allows Go to Source Definition to be triggered with the mouse gesture. Requires using TypeScript 4.7+ in the workspace.

javascript.referencesCodeLens.enabled.description: Enable/disable references CodeLens in JavaScript files.

javascript.referencesCodeLens.showOnAllF.description: Enable/disable references CodeLens on all functions in JavaScript files.

javascript.suggest.classMemberSnippets.e.description: Enable/disable snippet completions for class members.

javascript.suggest.completeFunctionCalls.description: Complete functions with their parameter signature.

javascript.suggest.completeJSDocs.description: Enable/disable suggestion to complete JSDoc comments.

javascript.suggest.includeAutomaticOptio.description: Enable/disable showing completions on potentially undefined values that insert an optional chain call. Requires strict null checks to be enabled.

javascript.suggest.includeCompletionsFor.description: Enable/disable auto-import-style completions on partially-typed import statements.

javascript.suggest.jsdoc.generateReturns.markdownDescription: Enable/disable generating `@returns` annotations for JSDoc templates.

javascript.suggest.names.markdownDescription: Enable/disable including unique names from the file in JavaScript suggestions. Note that name suggestions are always disabled in JavaScript code that is semantically checked using `@ts-check` or `checkJs`.

javascript.suggest.paths.description: Enable/disable suggestions for paths in import statements and require calls.

javascript.suggestionActions.enabled.description: Enable/disable suggestion diagnostics for JavaScript files in the editor.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Never rename paths and don't prompt.
javascript.updateImportsOnFileMove.enabl.description: Enable/disable automatic updating of import paths when you rename or move a file in VS Code.

js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs.markdownDescription: Enable/disable semantic checking of JavaScript files. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.experimental.markdownDescription: Enable/disable `experimentalDecorators` in JavaScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.module.markdownDescription: Sets the module system for the program. See more: https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#module.

js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.strictFuncti.markdownDescription: Enable/disable [strict function types](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictFunctionTypes) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.strictNullCh.markdownDescription: Enable/disable [strict null checks](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictNullChecks) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project. Existing `jsconfig.json` or `tsconfig.json` files override this setting.

js/ts.implicitProjectConfig.target.markdownDescription: Set target JavaScript language version for emitted JavaScript and include library declarations. See more: https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#target.

json.colorDecorators.enable.deprecationMessage: The setting `json.colorDecorators.enable` has been deprecated in favor of `editor.colorDecorators`.

json.format.keepLines.description: Keep all existing new lines when formatting.

json.maxItemsComputed.description: The maximum number of outline symbols and folding regions computed (limited for performance reasons).

json.schemaDownload.enable.description: When enabled, JSON schemas can be fetched from http and https locations.

json.schemas.description: Associate schemas to JSON files in the current project.

items.description: A file pattern that can contain '*' to match against when resolving JSON files to schemas.

fileMatch.description: An array of file patterns to match against when resolving JSON files to schemas. `*` can be used as a wildcard. Exclusion patterns can also be defined and start with '!'. A file matches when there is at least one matching pattern and the last matching pattern is not an exclusion pattern.

schema.description: The schema definition for the given URL. The schema only needs to be provided to avoid accesses to the schema URL.

url.description: A URL to a schema or a relative path to a schema in the current directory

json.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the JSON language server.

keyboard.dispatch.markdownDescription: Controls the dispatching logic for key presses to use either `code` (recommended) or `keyCode`.

launch.description: Global debug launch configuration. Should be used as an alternative to 'launch.json' that is shared across workspaces.

less.completion.completePropertyWithSemi.description: Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties.

less.completion.triggerPropertyValueComp.description: By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.

less.format.braceStyle.markdownDescription: Put braces on the same line as rules (`collapse`) or put braces on own line (`expand`).

less.format.maxPreserveNewLines.markdownDescription: Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk, when `#less.format.preserveNewLines#` is enabled.

less.format.newlineBetweenRules.markdownDescription: Separate rulesets by a blank line.

less.format.newlineBetweenSelectors.markdownDescription: Separate selectors with a new line.

less.format.preserveNewLines.markdownDescription: Whether existing line breaks before elements should be preserved.

less.format.spaceAroundSelectorSeparator.markdownDescription: Ensure a space character around selector separators '>', '+', '~' (e.g. `a > b`).

less.hover.documentation.description: Show tag and attribute documentation in LESS hovers.

less.hover.references.description: Show references to MDN in LESS hovers.

less.lint.boxModel.markdownDescription: Do not use `width` or `height` when using `padding` or `border`.

less.lint.compatibleVendorPrefixes.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix make sure to also include all other vendor-specific properties.

less.lint.duplicateProperties.description: Do not use duplicate style definitions.

less.lint.float.markdownDescription: Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.

less.lint.hexColorLength.description: Hex colors must consist of three or six hex numbers.

less.lint.idSelector.description: Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.

less.lint.ieHack.description: IE hacks are only necessary when supporting IE7 and older.

less.lint.important.markdownDescription: Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.

less.lint.importStatement.description: Import statements do not load in parallel.

less.lint.propertyIgnoredDueToDisplay.markdownDescription: Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.

less.lint.universalSelector.markdownDescription: The universal selector (`*`) is known to be slow.

less.lint.validProperties.description: A list of properties that are not validated against the `unknownProperties` rule.

less.lint.vendorPrefix.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.

markdown.copyFiles.destination.markdownDescription:
Defines where files copied created by drop or paste should be created. This is a map from globs that match on the Markdown document to destinations.

The destinations may use the following variables:

- `${documentFileName}` — The full filename of the Markdown document, for example: `readme.md`.
- `${documentBaseName}` — The basename of Markdown document, for example: `readme`.
- `${documentExtName}` — The extension of the Markdown document, for example: `md`.
- `${documentDirName}` — The name of the Markdown document's parent directory.
- `${documentWorkspaceFolder}` — The workspace folder for the Markdown document, for example: `/Users/me/myProject`. This is the same as `${documentDirName}` if the file is not part of a workspace.
- `${fileName}` — The file name of the dropped file, for example: `image.png`.

markdown.copyFiles.overwriteBehavior.markdownDescription: Controls if files created by drop or paste should overwrite existing files.
markdownEnumDescriptions: If a file with the same name already exists, append a number to the file name, for example: `image.png` becomes `image-1.png`.
If a file with the same name already exists, overwrite it.

markdown.editor.drop.copyIntoWorkspace.markdownDescription:
Controls if files outside of the workspace that are dropped into a Markdown editor should be copied into the workspace.

Use `#markdown.copyFiles.destination#` to configure where copied dropped files should be created
markdownEnumDescriptions: Try to copy external image and video files into the workspace.
Do not copy external files into the workspace.

markdown.editor.drop.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable dropping files into a Markdown editor while holding Shift. Requires enabling `#editor.dropIntoEditor.enabled#`.

markdown.editor.filePaste.copyIntoWorksp.markdownDescription:
Controls if files outside of the workspace that are pasted into a Markdown editor should be copied into the workspace.

Use `#markdown.copyFiles.destination#` to configure where copied files should be created.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Try to copy external image and video files into the workspace.
Do not copy external files into the workspace.

markdown.editor.filePaste.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable pasting files into a Markdown editor to create Markdown links. Requires enabling `#editor.pasteAs.enabled#`.

markdown.editor.pasteUrlAsFormattedLink..markdownDescription: Controls if a Markdown link is created when a URL is pasted into the Markdown editor. Requires enabling `#editor.pasteAs.enabled#`.

markdown.links.openLocation.description: Controls where links in Markdown files should be opened.
enumDescriptions: Open links beside the active editor.
Open links in the active editor group.

markdown.math.enabled.description: Enable/disable rendering math in the built-in Markdown preview.

markdown.math.macros.description: A collection of custom macros. Each macro is a key-value pair where the key is a new command name and the value is the expansion of the macro.

markdown.occurrencesHighlight.enabled.description: Enable highlighting link occurrences in the current document.

markdown.preferredMdPathExtensionStyle.markdownDescription: Controls if file extensions (e.g. `.md`) are added or not for links to Markdown files. This setting is used when file paths are added by tooling such as path completions or file renames.
markdownEnumDescriptions: For existing paths, try to maintain the file extension style. For new paths, add file extensions.
Prefer including the file extension. For example, path completions to a file named `file.md` will insert `file.md`.
Prefer removing the file extension. For example, path completions to a file named `file.md` will insert `file` without the `.md`.

markdown.preview.breaks.description:
Sets how line-breaks are rendered in the Markdown preview. Setting it to 'true' creates a
for newlines inside paragraphs.

markdown.preview.doubleClickToSwitchToEd.description: Double-click in the Markdown preview to switch to the editor.

markdown.preview.fontFamily.default: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe WPC', 'Segoe UI', system-ui, 'Ubuntu', 'Droid Sans', sans-serif
markdown.preview.fontFamily.description: Controls the font family used in the Markdown preview.
markdown.preview.fontFamily.defaultDefaultValue: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe WPC', 'Segoe UI', system-ui, 'Ubuntu', 'Droid Sans', sans-serif

markdown.preview.fontSize.description: Controls the font size in pixels used in the Markdown preview.

markdown.preview.lineHeight.description: Controls the line height used in the Markdown preview. This number is relative to the font size.

markdown.preview.linkify.description: Convert URL-like text to links in the Markdown preview.

markdown.preview.markEditorSelection.description: Mark the current editor selection in the Markdown preview.

markdown.preview.openMarkdownLinks.description: Controls how links to other Markdown files in the Markdown preview should be opened.
enumDescriptions: Try to open links in the editor.
Try to open links in the Markdown preview.

markdown.preview.scrollEditorWithPreview.description: When a Markdown preview is scrolled, update the view of the editor.

markdown.preview.scrollPreviewWithEditor.description: When a Markdown editor is scrolled, update the view of the preview.

markdown.preview.typographer.description: Enable some language-neutral replacement and quotes beautification in the Markdown preview.

markdown.server.log.description: Controls the logging level of the Markdown language server.

markdown.styles.description: A list of URLs or local paths to CSS style sheets to use from the Markdown preview. Relative paths are interpreted relative to the folder open in the Explorer. If there is no open folder, they are interpreted relative to the location of the Markdown file. All '\' need to be written as '\\'.

markdown.suggest.paths.enabled.description: Enable path suggestions while writing links in Markdown files.

markdown.suggest.paths.includeWorkspaceH.markdownDescription: Enable suggestions for headers in other Markdown files in the current workspace. Accepting one of these suggestions inserts the full path to header in that file, for example: `[link text](/path/to/file.md#header)`.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Enable workspace header suggestions after typing `##` in a path, for example: `[link text](##`.
Enable workspace header suggestions after typing either `##` or `#` in a path, for example: `[link text](#` or `[link text](##`.

markdown.trace.extension.description: Enable debug logging for the Markdown extension.

markdown.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Markdown language server.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Never try to update link and don't prompt.
markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.enabled.markdownDescription: Try to update links in Markdown files when a file is renamed/moved in the workspace. Use `#markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.include#` to configure which files trigger link updates.

markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.enableFor.description: Enable updating links when a directory is moved or renamed in the workspace.

markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.include.markdownDescription: Glob patterns that specifies files that trigger automatic link updates. See `#markdown.updateLinksOnFileMove.enabled#` for details about this feature.

items.description: The glob pattern to match file paths against. Set to true to enable the pattern.

markdown.validate.duplicateLinkDefinitio.markdownDescription: Validate duplicated definitions in the current file.

markdown.validate.enabled.description: Enable all error reporting in Markdown files.

markdown.validate.fileLinks.enabled.markdownDescription: Validate links to other files in Markdown files, for example `[link](/path/to/file.md)`. This checks that the target files exists. Requires enabling `#markdown.validate.enabled#`.

markdown.validate.fileLinks.markdownFrag.markdownDescription: Validate the fragment part of links to headers in other files in Markdown files, for example: `[link](/path/to/file.md#header)`. Inherits the setting value from `#markdown.validate.fragmentLinks.enabled#` by default.

markdown.validate.fragmentLinks.enabled.markdownDescription: Validate fragment links to headers in the current Markdown file, for example: `[link](#header)`. Requires enabling `#markdown.validate.enabled#`.

markdown.validate.ignoredLinks.markdownDescription: Configure links that should not be validated. For example adding `/about` would not validate the link `[about](/about)`, while the glob `/assets/**/*.svg` would let you skip validation for any link to `.svg` files under the `assets` directory.

markdown.validate.referenceLinks.enabled.markdownDescription: Validate reference links in Markdown files, for example: `[link][ref]`. Requires enabling `#markdown.validate.enabled#`.

markdown.validate.unusedLinkDefinitions..markdownDescription: Validate link definitions that are unused in the current file.

mediaPreview.video.autoPlay.markdownDescription: Start playing videos on mute automatically.

merge-conflict.autoNavigateNextConflict..description: Whether to automatically navigate to the next merge conflict after resolving a merge conflict.

merge-conflict.codeLens.enabled.description: Create a CodeLens for merge conflict blocks within editor.

merge-conflict.decorators.enabled.description: Create decorators for merge conflict blocks within editor.

merge-conflict.diffViewPosition.description: Controls where the diff view should be opened when comparing changes in merge conflicts.
enumDescriptions: Open the diff view below the current editor group.
Open the diff view next to the current editor group.
Open the diff view in the current editor group.

mergeEditor.showDeletionMarkers.description: Controls if deletions in base or one of the inputs should be indicated by a vertical bar.

microsoft-sovereign-cloud.customEnvironm.markdownDescription: The custom configuration for the Sovereign Cloud to use with the Microsoft Sovereign Cloud authentication provider. This along with setting `#microsoft-sovereign-cloud.environment#` to `custom` is required to use this feature.

activeDirectoryEndpointUrl.description: The Active Directory endpoint for the custom Sovereign Cloud.

activeDirectoryResourceId.description: The Active Directory resource ID for the custom Sovereign Cloud.

managementEndpointUrl.description: The management endpoint for the custom Sovereign Cloud.

name.description: The name of the custom Sovereign Cloud.

portalUrl.description: The portal URL for the custom Sovereign Cloud.

resourceManagerEndpointUrl.description: The resource manager endpoint for the custom Sovereign Cloud.

microsoft-sovereign-cloud.environment.markdownDescription: The Sovereign Cloud to use for authentication. If you select `custom`, you must also set the `#microsoft-sovereign-cloud.customEnvironment#` setting.
enumDescriptions: Azure China
A custom Microsoft Sovereign Cloud
Azure US Government

notebook.breadcrumbs.showCodeCells.markdownDescription: When enabled notebook breadcrumbs contain code cells.

notebook.cellFocusIndicator.description: Controls where the focus indicator is rendered, either along the cell borders or on the left gutter.

notebook.cellToolbarLocation.description: Where the cell toolbar should be shown, or whether it should be hidden.

additionalProperties.markdownDescription: Configure the cell toolbar position for for specific file types

notebook.cellToolbarVisibility.markdownDescription: Whether the cell toolbar should appear on hover or click.

notebook.codeActionsOnSave.markdownDescription: Experimental. Run a series of CodeActions for a notebook on save. CodeActions must be specified, the file must not be saved after delay, and the editor must not be shutting down. Example: `source.fixAll: true`

notebook.compactView.description: Control whether the notebook editor should be rendered in a compact form. For example, when turned on, it will decrease the left margin width.

notebook.confirmDeleteRunningCell.markdownDescription: Control whether a confirmation prompt is required to delete a running cell.

notebook.consolidatedOutputButton.description: Control whether outputs action should be rendered in the output toolbar.

notebook.consolidatedRunButton.description: Control whether extra actions are shown in a dropdown next to the run button.

notebook.diff.enablePreview.description: Whether to use the enhanced text diff editor for notebook.

notebook.diff.overviewRuler.description: Whether to render the overview ruler in the diff editor for notebook.

notebook.displayOrder.description: Priority list for output mime types

notebook.dragAndDropEnabled.description: Control whether the notebook editor should allow moving cells through drag and drop.

notebook.editorOptionsCustomizations.description: Settings for code editors used in notebooks. This can be used to customize most editor.* settings.

editor.acceptSuggestionOnCommitCharacter.markdownDescription: Controls whether suggestions should be accepted on commit characters. For example, in JavaScript, the semi-colon (`;`) can be a commit character that accepts a suggestion and types that character.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Only accept a suggestion with `Enter` when it makes a textual change.
editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter.markdownDescription: Controls whether suggestions should be accepted on `Enter`, in addition to `Tab`. Helps to avoid ambiguity between inserting new lines or accepting suggestions.

editor.accessibilityPageSize.description: Controls the number of lines in the editor that can be read out by a screen reader at once. When we detect a screen reader we automatically set the default to be 500. Warning: this has a performance implication for numbers larger than the default.

enumDescriptions: Use platform APIs to detect when a Screen Reader is attached
Assume a screen reader is not attached
Optimize for usage with a Screen Reader
editor.accessibilitySupport.description: Controls if the UI should run in a mode where it is optimized for screen readers.

enumDescriptions: Autoclose brackets only when the cursor is to the left of whitespace.
Use language configurations to determine when to autoclose brackets.
editor.autoClosingBrackets.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically close brackets after the user adds an opening bracket.

enumDescriptions: Remove adjacent closing quotes or brackets only if they were automatically inserted.
editor.autoClosingDelete.description: Controls whether the editor should remove adjacent closing quotes or brackets when deleting.

enumDescriptions: Type over closing quotes or brackets only if they were automatically inserted.
editor.autoClosingOvertype.description: Controls whether the editor should type over closing quotes or brackets.

enumDescriptions: Autoclose quotes only when the cursor is to the left of whitespace.
Use language configurations to determine when to autoclose quotes.
editor.autoClosingQuotes.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically close quotes after the user adds an opening quote.

enumDescriptions: The editor will keep the current line's indentation, honor language defined brackets and invoke special onEnterRules defined by languages.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation and honor language defined brackets.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation, honor language defined brackets, invoke special onEnterRules defined by languages, and honor indentationRules defined by languages.
The editor will keep the current line's indentation.
The editor will not insert indentation automatically.
editor.autoIndent.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically adjust the indentation when users type, paste, move or indent lines.

enumDescriptions: Surround with brackets but not quotes.
Use language configurations to determine when to automatically surround selections.
Surround with quotes but not brackets.
editor.autoSurround.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically surround selections when typing quotes or brackets.

editor.bracketPairColorization.enabled.markdownDescription: Controls whether bracket pair colorization is enabled or not. Use `#workbench.colorCustomizations#` to override the bracket highlight colors.

editor.bracketPairColorization.independe.description: Controls whether each bracket type has its own independent color pool.

editor.codeLens.description: Controls whether the editor shows CodeLens.

editor.codeLensFontFamily.description: Controls the font family for CodeLens.

editor.codeLensFontSize.markdownDescription: Controls the font size in pixels for CodeLens. When set to 0, 90% of `#editor.fontSize#` is used.

editor.colorDecorators.description: Controls whether the editor should render the inline color decorators and color picker.

enumDescriptions: Make the color picker appear on click of the color decorator
Make the color picker appear both on click and hover of the color decorator
Make the color picker appear on hover of the color decorator
editor.colorDecoratorsActivatedOn.description: Controls the condition to make a color picker appear from a color decorator

editor.colorDecoratorsLimit.markdownDescription: Controls the max number of color decorators that can be rendered in an editor at once.

editor.columnSelection.description: Enable that the selection with the mouse and keys is doing column selection.

editor.comments.ignoreEmptyLines.description: Controls if empty lines should be ignored with toggle, add or remove actions for line comments.

editor.comments.insertSpace.description: Controls whether a space character is inserted when commenting.

editor.copyWithSyntaxHighlighting.description: Controls whether syntax highlighting should be copied into the clipboard.

enumDescriptions: Smooth caret animation is enabled only when the user moves the cursor with an explicit gesture.
Smooth caret animation is disabled.
Smooth caret animation is always enabled.
editor.cursorSmoothCaretAnimation.description: Controls whether the smooth caret animation should be enabled.

editor.cursorSurroundingLines.description: Controls the minimal number of visible leading lines (minimum 0) and trailing lines (minimum 1) surrounding the cursor. Known as 'scrollOff' or 'scrollOffset' in some other editors.

enumDescriptions: `cursorSurroundingLines` is enforced always.
`cursorSurroundingLines` is enforced only when triggered via the keyboard or API.

editor.cursorWidth.markdownDescription: Controls the width of the cursor when `#editor.cursorStyle#` is set to `line`.

editor.defaultColorDecorators.markdownDescription: Controls whether inline color decorations should be shown using the default document color provider

editor.definitionLinkOpensInPeek.description: Controls whether the Go to Definition mouse gesture always opens the peek widget.

editor.dragAndDrop.description: Controls whether the editor should allow moving selections via drag and drop.

editor.dropIntoEditor.enabled.markdownDescription: Controls whether you can drag and drop a file into a text editor by holding down `shift` (instead of opening the file in an editor).

editor.dropIntoEditor.showDropSelector.markdownDescription: Controls if a widget is shown when dropping files into the editor. This widget lets you control how the file is dropped.
enumDescriptions: Show the drop selector widget after a file is dropped into the editor.
Never show the drop selector widget. Instead the default drop provider is always used.

editor.emptySelectionClipboard.description: Controls whether copying without a selection copies the current line.

enumDescriptions: Use a new rendering method with font characters.
Use the stable rendering method.
Use a new rendering method with svgs.
editor.experimentalWhitespaceRendering.description: Controls whether whitespace is rendered with a new, experimental method.

editor.find.addExtraSpaceOnTop.description: Controls whether the Find Widget should add extra lines on top of the editor. When true, you can scroll beyond the first line when the Find Widget is visible.

enumDescriptions: Always turn on Find in Selection automatically.
Turn on Find in Selection automatically when multiple lines of content are selected.
Never turn on Find in Selection automatically (default).
editor.find.autoFindInSelection.description: Controls the condition for turning on Find in Selection automatically.

editor.find.cursorMoveOnType.description: Controls whether the cursor should jump to find matches while typing.

editor.find.globalFindClipboard.description: Controls whether the Find Widget should read or modify the shared find clipboard on macOS.

editor.find.loop.description: Controls whether the search automatically restarts from the beginning (or the end) when no further matches can be found.

enumDescriptions: Always seed search string from the editor selection, including word at cursor position.
Never seed search string from the editor selection.
Only seed search string from the editor selection.
editor.find.seedSearchStringFromSelectio.description: Controls whether the search string in the Find Widget is seeded from the editor selection.

editor.folding.description: Controls whether the editor has code folding enabled.

editor.foldingHighlight.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight folded ranges.

editor.foldingImportsByDefault.description: Controls whether the editor automatically collapses import ranges.

editor.foldingMaximumRegions.description: The maximum number of foldable regions. Increasing this value may result in the editor becoming less responsive when the current source has a large number of foldable regions.

enumDescriptions: Use a language-specific folding strategy if available, else the indentation-based one.
Use the indentation-based folding strategy.
editor.foldingStrategy.description: Controls the strategy for computing folding ranges.

anyOf.description: Enables/Disables font ligatures ('calt' and 'liga' font features). Change this to a string for fine-grained control of the 'font-feature-settings' CSS property.
Explicit 'font-feature-settings' CSS property. A boolean can be passed instead if one only needs to turn on/off ligatures.

editor.fontLigatures.description: Configures font ligatures or font features. Can be either a boolean to enable/disable ligatures or a string for the value of the CSS 'font-feature-settings' property.

editor.fontSize.description: Controls the font size in pixels.

anyOf.description: Enables/Disables the translation from font-weight to font-variation-settings. Change this to a string for fine-grained control of the 'font-variation-settings' CSS property.
Explicit 'font-variation-settings' CSS property. A boolean can be passed instead if one only needs to translate font-weight to font-variation-settings.

editor.fontVariations.description: Configures font variations. Can be either a boolean to enable/disable the translation from font-weight to font-variation-settings or a string for the value of the CSS 'font-variation-settings' property.

anyOf.errorMessage: Only "normal" and "bold" keywords or numbers between 1 and 1000 are allowed.

editor.fontWeight.description: Controls the font weight. Accepts "normal" and "bold" keywords or numbers between 1 and 1000.

editor.formatOnPaste.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically format the pasted content. A formatter must be available and the formatter should be able to format a range in a document.

editor.formatOnType.description: Controls whether the editor should automatically format the line after typing.

editor.glyphMargin.description: Controls whether the editor should render the vertical glyph margin. Glyph margin is mostly used for debugging.

editor.gotoLocation.alternativeReference.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Reference' is the current location.

editor.gotoLocation.alternativeTypeDefin.description: Alternative command id that is being executed when the result of 'Go to Type Definition' is the current location.

editor.gotoLocation.multiple.deprecationMessage: This setting is deprecated, please use separate settings like 'editor.editor.gotoLocation.multipleDefinitions' or 'editor.editor.gotoLocation.multipleImplementations' instead.

editor.gotoLocation.multipleDeclarations.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Declaration'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Show Peek view of the results (default)

editor.gotoLocation.multipleDefinitions.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Definition'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Show Peek view of the results (default)

editor.gotoLocation.multipleImplementati.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Implementations'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Show Peek view of the results (default)

editor.gotoLocation.multipleReferences.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to References'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Show Peek view of the results (default)

editor.gotoLocation.multipleTypeDefiniti.description: Controls the behavior the 'Go to Type Definition'-command when multiple target locations exist.
enumDescriptions: Go to the primary result and enable Peek-less navigation to others
Go to the primary result and show a Peek view
Show Peek view of the results (default)
Enables bracket pair guides only for the active bracket pair.
Disables bracket pair guides.
Enables bracket pair guides.
editor.guides.bracketPairs.description: Controls whether bracket pair guides are enabled or not.

enumDescriptions: Enables horizontal guides only for the active bracket pair.
Disables horizontal bracket pair guides.
Enables horizontal guides as addition to vertical bracket pair guides.
editor.guides.bracketPairsHorizontal.description: Controls whether horizontal bracket pair guides are enabled or not.

editor.guides.highlightActiveBracketPair.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight the active bracket pair.

enumDescriptions: Highlights the active indent guide even if bracket guides are highlighted.
Do not highlight the active indent guide.
Highlights the active indent guide.
editor.guides.highlightActiveIndentation.description: Controls whether the editor should highlight the active indent guide.

editor.guides.indentation.description: Controls whether the editor should render indent guides.

editor.hideCursorInOverviewRuler.description: Controls whether the cursor should be hidden in the overview ruler.

editor.hover.above.description: Prefer showing hovers above the line, if there's space.

editor.hover.delay.description: Controls the delay in milliseconds after which the hover is shown.

editor.hover.enabled.description: Controls whether the hover is shown.

editor.hover.sticky.description: Controls whether the hover should remain visible when mouse is moved over it.

editor.inlayHints.enabled.description: Enables the inlay hints in the editor.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Inlay hints are hidden by default and show when holding Ctrl+Alt
Inlay hints are showing by default and hide when holding Ctrl+Alt

editor.inlayHints.fontFamily.markdownDescription: Controls font family of inlay hints in the editor. When set to empty, the `#editor.fontFamily#` is used.

editor.inlayHints.fontSize.markdownDescription: Controls font size of inlay hints in the editor. As default the `#editor.fontSize#` is used when the configured value is less than `5` or greater than the editor font size.

editor.inlayHints.padding.description: Enables the padding around the inlay hints in the editor.

editor.inlineSuggest.enabled.description: Controls whether to automatically show inline suggestions in the editor.

enumDescriptions: Show the inline suggestion toolbar whenever an inline suggestion is shown.
Show the inline suggestion toolbar when hovering over an inline suggestion.
editor.inlineSuggest.showToolbar.description: Controls when to show the inline suggestion toolbar.

editor.inlineSuggest.suppressSuggestions.description: Controls how inline suggestions interact with the suggest widget. If enabled, the suggest widget is not shown automatically when inline suggestions are available.

editor.letterSpacing.description: Controls the letter spacing in pixels.

editor.lightbulb.enabled.description: Enables the Code Action lightbulb in the editor.

editor.lineHeight.markdownDescription:
Controls the line height. 
 - Use 0 to automatically compute the line height from the font size.
 - Values between 0 and 8 will be used as a multiplier with the font size.
 - Values greater than or equal to 8 will be used as effective values.

enumDescriptions: Line numbers are rendered every 10 lines.
Line numbers are not rendered.
Line numbers are rendered as absolute number.
Line numbers are rendered as distance in lines to cursor position.
editor.lineNumbers.description: Controls the display of line numbers.

editor.linkedEditing.description: Controls whether the editor has linked editing enabled. Depending on the language, related symbols such as HTML tags, are updated while editing.

editor.links.description: Controls whether the editor should detect links and make them clickable.

editor.minimap.autohide.description: Controls whether the minimap is hidden automatically.

editor.minimap.enabled.description: Controls whether the minimap is shown.

editor.minimap.maxColumn.description: Limit the width of the minimap to render at most a certain number of columns.

editor.minimap.renderCharacters.description: Render the actual characters on a line as opposed to color blocks.

editor.minimap.scale.description: Scale of content drawn in the minimap: 1, 2 or 3.

editor.minimap.showSlider.description: Controls when the minimap slider is shown.

editor.minimap.side.description: Controls the side where to render the minimap.

enumDescriptions: The minimap will stretch or shrink as necessary to fill the height of the editor (no scrolling).
The minimap will shrink as necessary to never be larger than the editor (no scrolling).
The minimap has the same size as the editor contents (and might scroll).
